Name: Flirtalarm
Description:
The dream couple is being sought for a theater project or the school sport championships. Find the best matching pairs for specific events. Romance, sportiness, popularity and interests / talents play the most important roles in the right combination of the dream couples. Jokers influence the gameplay and do not allow pairings to arise or change them in unexpected directions.


     6 playing cards - 3 boys and 3 girls cards - are issued to each player
     3 event cards are laid open
     Players take turns taking a card to an event and reloading a new card
     the player who completes the pair to the event receives the cards
     Joker cards (suspend, blockade, veto) can affect the game for your own benefit
     the game ends when all event cards have been played
     the player with the most points wins the game


—user summary

Name: Under Construction: Poland
Description:
We are currently observing the largest construction boom in Poland since the reconstruction after World War II. These days not storks but steel cranes are characteristic Features of Polish landscape.

The players are directors of large construction companies. The companies succeeded in winning numerous tenders and divided Poland into several areas of operation. Each player hurries to perform tasks in several voivodeships, since Polish people and business need new roads and bridges.

Name: 5 Minute Samurai
Description:
This is a 5 Minute card game. you have a have a hand of 6 cards. you play higher and high until someone can't play and they get those cards to a pile to be counted later for scoring. play is over rounds until the deck is gone. then game is over and hands left are discarded into pile to be counted. cards 1 to 13, with 2 different wild cards per deck. This game is 1 to 4 player, but 2 decks can be put together to make it 8 players.

—user summary

Name: Spell Smashers: Helm of Sponsorship
Description:
A promo card for Spell Smashers from several different Kickstarter campaigns including Game Boy Geek 2019 (Season 7), Tantrum House 2019 (Season 6), and the Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast 2019 Tabletop Media Bonanza Kickstarter campaign (2019 Promo Pack). A generic art version is available, but each campaign offers alternate art versions of the card as well.

Suffer no wounds when you defeat a monster. (not for solo gaming)

Name: Trumps & Ladders
Description:
Trumps & Ladders is a trick-taking party game.

A new party game that takes a humorous spin on a divisive political subject - the border wall. The game is simple & similar to spades. The first player lays down anything they want, and players must follow suit. If a player cannot follow suit, he may play a ‘Trump’ or lose the round. The hand is won by the player who has the highest ‘Trump’ or ‘immigration’ card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Revolutionary War Battlefield
Description:
A simple game where the British and Continental armies  move around a board to capture enemy pieces, place their flags signifying the capture of key locations, then move on the enemy's capital to capture it an win the game.
The game can also be won by destroying the enemy army.  Movement is by die roll.  the pieces are designated as infantry, cavalry and cannon and have differing qualities. The rules are one page, and is vaguely reminiscent of the American Heritage series game Battle Cry.

—description from the publisher

Name: Echek
Description:
Echek is a chess-inspired game which is played with only 12 cards and without an actual board.
Each player has 6 pieces (King, Queen, Root, Bishop, Knight and Pawn) with chess-like moves and they play on a 4x4 virtual square.
The game begins with both Kings face to face, and each turn players can move a piece or put a piece into play.
The game ends when a King is surrounded by 4 pieces.

—user summary

Name: Thera
Description:
In 1646 BC, the island of Thera (present day Santorini) was the site of a volcanic eruption one hundred times more powerful than Pompeii. This eruption coincided with the decline of the Minoan civilization and the rise of the Mycenaean civilization. Due to Thera's strategic location, the Mycanaean wanax (king) has decided that it is time to rebuild Thera and has tasked you, one of his koreters (governors) with this responsibility. The koreter who best rebuilds Thera to its prior glory will be victorious.

In the role-selection and resource-management game Thera, each player has a map of the island where they will engage in trade, clear ash, generate resources, move those resources to building sites across the island, and construct economic and luxury buildings. On a player's turn, they select one of five roles from the rondel. Every player can benefit from this role, and the one who chose it gets benefits that scale with the amount of favor on the role. Favor accumulates on roles over the course of the game and is redistributed every time a role is chosen. Here's an overview of the five roles:


    The Priestess prays for rain, bringing the life-giving resource to the island.
    The Worker consumes that water and produces resources.
    The Planner moves those resources around Thera so that they can be used for construction or trade.
    The Builder uses those resources to construct buildings on undeveloped sites across the island.
    The Trader buys and sells resources at the port.


Players earn points by constructing buildings. You must get the needed resources to the desired building site, then acquire the building plans (which are available to all from a common building tableau). Should you build another quarry (a resource-generating building), or are you worried one of your competitors will take that temple (a luxury building) that aligns with your strategy? Time is of the essence in Thera, so efficient planning and resource management are important in winning the day.

—description from the publisher

Name: WWIII
Description:
An expansion kit designed to substantially expand SPI's "NATO" and allow it to be combined with the games "The East is Red" and "Sinai". The variant relies on some additional material published in issue #5 of JagdPanther as well as a few articles from their newsletter. The rules describe the three players as the Chinese, Russian, and NATO player, but the units controlled by each player stretch beyond these shorthand designations.

The 11 pages of rules include a combined turn order, strategic movement grids (for tracking movement of units between the three games), limitations on national objectives, victory conditions, and setup instructions. Additional components include three charts for strategic and rail movement, three sheets of additional counters, and several mapsheet extensions that serve to expand the area covered by the NATO mapsheets.

This expansion is currently available in PDF format as Amarillo Design Bureau has digitally rereleased all issues of JagdPanther magazine.

—user summary

Name: Ocracoke
Description:
æµ·è³Šã®å®å³¶ ï½žã‚ªã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚³ãƒ¼ã‚¯ï½ž is a trick taking game.  The goal is to collect the most treasure in multiple rounds.

There are 36 cards in 4 suits, each with 9 cards from 1 to 5.  Some cards will have a treasure with them.  Each player will have 4 rum tokens at the beginning.  Each player is dealt 4 cards.  During each trick, players have to follow the lead suit.  In case a player cannot follow, he draws a card and place it face down in front of him, which he will take it into his hand.  (A playerr can also intentionally pass to draw one more card.)  Otherwise, the player who plays the highest card wins the trick.  He places the collected treasures (on the card) in front of himself.  In case of a tie, the card with skull wins the trick.

When a player empties his hand, he escapes.  When two players escape, the round ends.  If a player escapes without collecting 3 treasures, he is punished for being a coward.  He turns over a rum token to chicken token.  If a player escapes with 3 or more treasures, he get a score equal to the number of collected treasure.  For other players who cannot escape, they will be caught by the navy and lost a life (rum token).

The game ends when (i) a player has over 15 scores, or (ii) all players lost their last life.  In case (i), the winner is who collected more treasures.  In case (ii), everyone loses.

—user summary

Name: Pociąg do Zakopanego
Description:
Train to Zakopane is an economic game in which players for eight rounds place their representatives on the action track and perform various action, such as taking raw materials, exchanging raw materials, investments in infrastructure construction, construction of the Zakopane railway and a court trial for Morskie Oko. The action track, which runs around the board, allows players to occupy any field, except that employees cannot go back to the fields they have missed. At the beginning of each round in order of players, they choose one of the available bonuses. After each round, players earn a profit from their investments and victory points.

—description from the designer

Name: Leaders (fan expansion for 7 Wonders Duel)
Description:
In 7 Wonders Duel: Leaders all of your favorite historical Leaders from the Leaders expansion return for you to incorporate into your games of 7 Wonders Duel!

This fan expansion adds a step at the beginning of the game for players to draft their leaders (similar in style to the drafting of Wonders) and additional steps at the beginning of each age to recruit those leaders.

Includes 42 leaders from the original 7 Wonders, plus one new leader, da Vinci.

Also included is two wonders new to 7 Wonders Duel, Rome (which gives you access to more leaders) and Abu Simbel (which allows you to bury leaders for victory points).

Fans of the leader expansion for the original game will find this an exciting new addition to their games of Duel!

Permission of this fan expansion has been granted from 7 Wonders publisher, Repos Production.

-description from designer

Name: Meet the Manchers
Description:
Meet the Manchers is a game in which  each player  is a family member  from the Manchers family, who are  about to have  their traditional Sunday feast.  Some families go to church, some families take picnics, the Manchers have their Sunday feast. Many dishes will be cooked, not everyone will try them all, because this is not a quiet family dinner oh no,  it is more of a race  filled with many flavors and nutrition accompanied with the occasional duel  for table dominance. However,  rules must still  be obeyed, table manners  are  important, the nicest member will be praised and will get a reward, the naughtiest member will be scold and left to do the dishes. Eating tasty food is important, but more so are the flavors  and nutrition. Will you be the one who will accomplish all three, or be stuck  with dishes…

—description from the publisher

Name: Journey: Wrath of Demons – Jiangshi Coffin Set
Description:
The infamous Chinese hopping zombie, known for their stiff gait, Invade the Kingdom of Terra!

This set contains all you need to add the Jiangshi to your existing Bull Demon Quests.  It contains highly detailed unpainted plastic miniatures, cards and rules, together with 2 brand new Quests with a new story line.  Multiple Jiangshi Coffin Sets can be used together to create a Chinese Zombie Horde.

—description from the publisher

Name: Divisions in Flames Collector's Edition
Description:
Divisions in Flames is Australian Design Group's newest World in Flames Collector's edition expansion that dramatically expands the scale of World in Flames to include many of the standard divisions, Infantry, armour, paras etc. as well as all the special forces like rangers, SNLF, Brandenburgers, NKVD and airlanding units for all the major powers and quite a few minors. Now you can fight an island hopping campaign, reduce losses in combat and launch probing raids deep into the enemy's rear.

Divisions in Flames also includes artillery, from the smallest to the most devastating anti tank guns, mobile anti aircraft, fixed flak, tank destroyers and self-propelled guns to shore up your defence and prise open theirs.

Finally we also include the Soviet Guards Banner armies and divisions that turn the Soviet army from a tenacious to a formidable foe capable of going toe to toe with Germany's finest panzer corps. 

Divisions in Flames, like all the Collector edition expansions, is playable with Patton in Flames or America in Flames as well as World in Flames. Divisions in Flames includes 400 full-colour counters that turn World in Flames from a great into an unforgettable experience.

—description from the publisher

Name: Territories in Flames Collector's Edition
Description:
Territories in Flames is Australian Design Group's newest World in Flames Collector's edition expansion that dramatically expands the scope of World in Flames in all those parts of the globe that were vital to the economies of the great powers but peripheral to the major theaters of combat.
 World War II was just as much the field of diplomacy and politics as it was industry and mighty armies, and from the jungles of Burma to the mountains of Kilimanjaro people across the globe had to choose sides in this global struggle.

Although the Axis powers only had sporadic plans for overseas empire, there were many yearning to throw off the yoke of the colonial powers and only too glad to help their supposed liberators.

Territories in Flames includes all the locally raised overseas troops, city based volunteers, (the ultimate fantasy Christmas present scenario, Japan conquers Singapore then China liberates it, easy peasy), warlords, Siberians, the Ukrainian national army, forts, coastal forts, roads, rails, facilities and saved oil & build points.

Territories in Flames is playable with Patton in Flames or America in Flames as well as World in Flames.
 Territories in Flames includes 400 full-colour counters that turn World in Flames from a great into an unforgettable experience.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shipwrights of the North Sea: Garphill Games 5-Year Anniversary Promos
Description:
Contained in the Garphill Games 5-Year Anniversary Promo Pack - a special set of web-exclusive promo packs for some of Garphill Games' releases from the past 5 years.

These are the cards included in that pack that expand Shipwrights of the North Sea:

9 New Townsfolk Cards for Shipwrights
- Warmonger x2
- Gatekeeper x2
- Brawler x2
- Champion x3
Families: Series: The North Sea Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Architects of the West Kingdom: Garphill Games 5-Year Anniversary Promo Cards
Description:
Contained in the Garphill Games 5-Year Anniversary Promo Pack - a special set of web-exclusive promo packs for some of Garphill Games' releases from the past 5 years.

These are the cards included in that pack that expand Architects of the West Kingdom:

5 New Apprentice Cards for Architects
- Watchman x2
- Defender x2
- Abbot
3 New Viking Building Cards for Architects
- Viking Market Hall
- Viking Church
- Viking Boat House

Abbot - Plus 1 Virtue when taking the King's Storehouse action.

Watchman - Pay 1 less Silver (not Tax) when taking either of the following Guardhouse actions: -release their Workers from other player's boards, -pay off Debt.

Defender - When taking the Town Centre action, the player may release 2 of their Workers from the Prison.

Viking Market Hall - The controlling player immediately gains 3 Gold.

Viking Church - The controlling player gains 1 VP for each level of work done advancing construction on the Cathedral. This effect happens at game end.

Viking Boat House - The controlling player may choose to immediately loses 1 Virtue and gain 3 Wood.
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Walking in Burano: Mini Expansion 1 – New Inhabitants
Description:
This expansion contains 3 additional Inhabitant Cards (2 of each) and 3 rule cards.

Availability:
Currently, they are available inside the box of the AEG edition and as a separate card pack from Board Game Circus (German version). It will be sold separately by EmperorS4 and Board Game Circus at their booth at some events like Essen Spiel.

Rules:
Add the 3 new types of Inhabitant Cards into the basic 7 types (a total of 10 types), and randomly choose 7 types of them. Place them following the Game Setup as base game.

Name: Grand Sumo
Description:
Grand Sumo is a 2-player card game based on the 1,500 year old sport of sumo wrestling, in which you will be programming your wrestler’s actions through card play and aim to either push you opponent out of the ring, or wrestle him to the ground.

Like real sumo bouts, you can attempt to attack aggressively in hope of a quick victory, or try to outwit and outlast your opponent.

Each bout in Grand Sumo consists of 3 contacts, where you will simultaneously program your wrestlers' actions by playing cards face down in front of you. When both players are ready, the cards are revealed one at a time, and resolved as pushing, wrestling and defensive actions in the ring.

The player who manages to push or rotate the wrestlers token to meet a winning condition wins the bout, and the first player to win 3 bouts will be crowned the winner of Grand Sumo.

-description from designer

Name: Zany Zoo
Description:
Zany Zoo is a card drafting game for 1 to 3 players, where you play as zoologists gathering creatures that emerged from another dimension, and taking care of them.

The game is played over 3 rounds, where 5 multi-use cards are dealt to each player per round, from which you will draft 4 for a total of 12 cards. You will then utilize 1 of the 3 functions of these cards to either build your creatures, feed them or clean up their wastes to score victory points.

You decide which strategy to adopt as there are a few ways to score victory points. Manage your sanctuary well to score more victory points than your opponent and be recognized as the ‘best zoologist of the third dimension’!

-description from designer

Name: Jenus: Il gioco – Espansione: Angeli & Demoni
Description:
After the successful success of Jenus - Il gioco, finally arrives its worthy expansion: Angels & Demons!

Fight in your normal version or choose the upgraded one to summon angels; exploits the forces of evil without restraint, recalling the 4 major demons through Ratzinger; perform new miracles and smash the deities with new fantastic indulgences!

Angels & Demons improves the gameplay of the basic version of Jenus - The game, taking advantage of the advice of the most loyal players and allowing you to use new ways to eradicate the opponent, turn up the nose to moralists and piss off the aunts bigoted.

With Angels & Demons the world is facing the ultimate challenge: the eternal struggle between good and evil.
And where are you going to be?

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dopo il fortunato sul cesso di “Jenus – Il gioco”, arriva finalmente la sua degna espansione: “Angeli & Demoni”!
Combatti nella tua versione normale o scegli quella potenziata per evocare gli angeli; sfrutta senza ritegno alcuno le forze del male, richiamando i 4 demoni maggiori tramite Ratzinger; compi nuovi miracoli e sfotti le divinità con nuove fantastiche indulgenze!
“Angeli & Demoni” migliora il gameplay della versione base di “Jenus – Il gioco”, facendo tesoro dei consigli dei giocatori più affezionati e consentendo di utilizzare nuove strade per debellare l’avversario, far storcere il naso ai moralisti e fare incazzare le zie bigotte.
Con “Angeli & Demoni” il mondo si trova ad affrontare la sfida definitiva: l’eterna lotta tra il bene e il male.
E tu da che parte starai?

—description from the publisher

Name: MythMash
Description:
MythMash is a worldbuilding and story generation game in which players draw prompts and improvise a vibrant narrative together. It's simple rules and sandbox style make it a versatile tool for planning character backstories, lore and questlines. It can also be used as a real time campaign aide, creative writing generator or improv. prompt tool!
—description from the designer

Name: Dicetopia: The Steve Experience solo expansion
Description:
This is Steve. He is quite the moody guy and you can never be certain of how he will react, what he’ll do or possibly hurt... Honestly, he probably shouldn’t play games at all actually. But here we are, and sometimes we can’t be too picky with our gaming company can we?

Go up against the moody Steve in this thrilling 9 Cards expansion designed for solo play! It can also be included in 2 player games to spice things up!

—description from the publisher

Name: Road to Reno
Description:
In this 2-4 player game your goal is simple: win a $1,000 hand of blackjack at Casino Reno and win the game. Along the way you'll gamble, bluff, buy, and bet to avoid being left penniless in the desert.

Players move around the game board by pulling cards from the top of a draw pile. They can also bet on these movement cards to make money and win action cards. The spaces on the board offer opportunities to gain asset and action cards, gamble in casinos, and play poker against other players. Avoid losing money when players gamble in your casino and manage to make money when you gamble in other players' casinos and you'll be in Reno before you know it!

—description from the publisher

Name: Stonehenge: Ring of Stones
Description:
Ring of Stones is a fun and easy game that can be played with one or two players. For one player, see how fast you can build the ring of stones and compete against your friends for the best time. For two players, take it in turns to roll the dice to add or dismantle pieces of the circle. The one who completes or clears the board is the winner.
It consists of a circle of stones that replicates the design of Stonehenge’s outer sarsen circle.

—user summary

Name: Archers of Godfrey
Description:
An intense cooperative, dice-rolling, unique tower defense set in a medieval fantasy world for 1 to 4 players. Have you ever wanted to be an archer on a castle wall? Now is your chance because all players play as archers defending against four powerful armies all attacking at once. Will the small band of archers defend the great castle of Godfrey or will the four Captains of the armies gain control of the castle? It is up to you and your team of archers so, “Notch, Draw, Loose!”

How To Win:
Players win if all four Captains are killed before one reaches the Center of the Keep.

Players lose if:
>> A Captain reaches the Keep at the center of the Inner Court. 
>> All ten soldiers of any one army are placed on their quadrant in the bailey.
>> The Player’s Deck has no more cards left to draw.

General Gameplay:
The goal of the game is to kill all 4 Captains before 1 advances to the Keep. Archers will be attacking the Captains with their arrows while eliminating the invading armies. Players will also use cards and purchase items from the Archer’s Equipment to accomplish this goal.

Every normal arrow is worth 1 damage unless otherwise stated on the cards or with special abilities. Each archer has 5 arrows and 5 spaces to move each turn.

The 12mm dice are the soldiers of the different armies that are invading the castle. The health of a soldier is determined by what it rolls. Archers can ONLY attack soldiers in their row of their quadrant. Archers kill soldiers with their arrows by reducing the soldier’s health down to 0.  Archers receive an Archer Trophy for each soldier they kill during their turn. Archers will use these trophies to purchase equipment to help them defeat the Captains.

When a soldier's health reaches 0, then remove that dice from the bailey and place it back on its army’s card in the Gathering Area. The soldier dice will be rolled again and placed in a future round.

Archers do NOT receive an Archer Trophy if soldier dice are killed while being placed during the Enemy phase. However, Archers do earn trophies for soldier dice killed by barrels and cards that upgrade their arrows.

Most of the cards are split and have two options.  Players choose one option to play and then discard. Players CANNOT play both of the options on the split cards. Split cards are designed to help for the different situations that players find themselves in.

Each round has two phases: Archer Phase and Enemy Phase.

Archer Phase
Each Archer Phase consists of all 4 archers taking their turns.

Player’s Turn:
Draw 1 Card 
Add to hand or follow the instructions if it is an Enemy Card. “Captain Advance” cards advance the Captain to the next space in their trail toward the Keep at the center of the Inner Court.
“Extra Soldier” cards will add an additional soldier to be placed during the Enemy Phase of that round (

2) Anytime during an archer’s turn they may:
Move 5 spaces and Shoot 5 arrows.
Play 1 card from your hand OR purchase items from the Archer's Equipment
If you purchase items, then you CANNOT play a card in the same turn.
If you play a card, then you CANNOT purchase items in the same turn.

3) Discard for hand limit
4) Pass the 1st player Castle Token to the person on your left (Clockwise)

Player’s Movement:
Archers are allowed to move to any space along the castle walls with a yellow border. Only one archer is allowed on each space along the wall. However, two archers may be on a “Starting Position” at the same time while they are moving along the wall. And as archers move past another archer, they CANNOT shoot arrows in the row of the other archer as they pass over them.

Stairs do not count as a space, the Archers just walk through them to the next space with a yellow border. Start positions do count as one space when the Archers are moving around to the other wall.

Enemy Phase
Each Enemy phase begins immediately following the Archer Phase. 
The Enemy Phase consists of 3 elements:
Roll the d8 Captain dice and resolve.
Check what number you rolled with the Roman numerals on the 4 corner towers. Whatever number you rolled, the Captain in that quadrant advances one space.

If the Captain is in the bailey,then add a rolled soldier in the space that the Captain advanced from.

If the Captain is in the Inner Court, then resolve any Barricades that they might have passed through. No soldiers are ever placed in the Inner Court.

If that Captain is dead, then nothing happens. Take a deep breathe. You DO NOT re-roll if you rolled to advance a dead Captain.
Roll the Soldier Placement dice for each of the 4 armies and place 2 soldiers on to each quadrant of the bailey.

Roll 8 new soldiers (2 for each army) and place them on the two soldier positions of their army card. These will be placed in the next round during the Enemy Phase.
The highest health is placed in position #1
The lowest health is placed in position #2

After rolling the NEXT soldiers and placing them on their army cards, then the Archer Phase of the next round begins

Name: Men In Black: Undercover
Description:
Aliens exist! But what will you do with that knowledge?

In Men In Black: Undercover, you play as a member of three different groups with three very different goals. The Men In Black are a secret organization who supervise alien activity on Earth and work to keep their existence hidden from the general population. Meanwhile, members of the Shadow Government are doing everything in their power to capture aliens and weaponize them. Lastly, there are the Conspiracy Theorists who are working toward proving the existence of aliens to the world.

Which side will come out on top? That's where you come in! Join a team and influence the aliens to join your cause, but make sure you aren't too obvious with your goals. After all, you'll need to stay undercover to win...

Name: Tournament Fishing: The Deckbuilding Game – Rods and Boats
Description:
Tournament Fishing: Rods and Boats adds a couple new and exciting things to the core game experience!

First of all, the Fishing Pole and Boat cards bring two new cards to each Angler's Starting Deck, which will be different every game. This addition expands the Angler's options and gives a strong boost to the early fishing game.

Secondly, the new 6PM Clock card optionally extends the Tournament another round for both the Solo, Co-op (2 Anglers), and Competative (2-4 Anglers) mode. Give yourselves that one last "Hoorah!" and go out in style. For the Solo/Co-op Tournament, the AI Angler catches a 7th Fish of your choice.

—description from the designer

Name: Chess Unbound
Description:
Chess Unbound is a two-player game based on traditional chess.  The unique concept in Chess Unbound is that each piece's movement is indicated by the space it occupies on the chessboard.  Each space on the game board contains a modular tile that shows a movement style from traditional chess (pawn, knight, rook, etc.).  When you move a piece, follow the movement style on its current space.  When the piece comes to rest, the space it lands on will indicate how it moves next turn.

The object of the game is to capture your opponent's king. The king piece is the only unique piece in the game, in that it never follows the movement rules of the spaces it occupies (it only moves like a king in traditional chess).

—user summary

Name: Soulbound
Description:
Paragon Studio's flagship game, Soulbound is a strategic battle card game experience unlike any other before it. Utilising the "everything in one box" model, everyone who plays Soulbound will be able to experience the game as it is intended to be, without the financial investment hurdle. Feel the thrill of commanding creatures of mythology to become the next Soulbound!

Along with creatures of mythology, Soulbound introduces a unique take on explaining what happened to these creatures that stoppped their existence in Modern Day planet Earth. Explore how the unknown war of the heavens and hell, known as "The Vanishing", caused Pandora's Box to thrust creatures of mythology and Gods alike into an alternate reality of planet Earth, known as Axiom07 by the greater beings. To the local population, the planet is called Duhra, and they have no idea about the darkness that they will have to fight back in order to survive.

Soulbound is the world's first battle card game that gives you the authentic Trading Card Game experience, while incorporating a heavy influence from Tactical Turn-Based Strategy Role-Playing games and a "Dynamic Resource" system. With Melee creatures, Ranged creatures and Support creatures, players will get to make new kinds of tactical decisions.

Every game of Soulbound comes with every card available. It also comes with two starter decks pre-configured so that players can learn that game before jumping in to the deck building aspect. In a box, 2 players can easily create two competitive decks. For the most competitive players, they may find they need a copy of the game for their own. With an abundance of available cards to build decks from, your ability to make the correct tactical decisions will be the biggest difference in a game. Skill should always determine the best player, not the player with the deepest pockets.

Soulbound is played over a series of turns in which you, an Animan of the planet Duhra, command creatures in battle against other Animan to work your way up to the title of "Soulbound" and be entrusted with fighting back the darkness that escaped from Pandora's Tome. Utilising your own Soul Energy, you begin your turn by building up your resource to Call creatures to the field. Creatures are able to act the turn they are played to the field which creates a very high tempo game. Having a strong offence is just as important as having a strong defence, as your resource also acts as your life force. Throughout a game, it can be attacked and fluctuates because of that. No linear resource growth here.

Through the many creatures' abilities and combat, players attempt to make tactical decisions to break through the opponent's defences and deal damage to the opponent's resource. A skillful players will be able to manage both their own resource and their opponent's resource to ensure they always can have the upper hand.

With outstanding table presence, outstanding art, and outstanding gameplay, Soulbound will keep you engaged and constantly creating new combos in your head. In the end, the only thing that matters is dealing 60 Soul Damage to your opponent and claiming your spot among the Soulbound.

—description from the publisher

Name: I'm Going Down
Description:
I'm Going Down (IGD) is a print-and-play solitaire game about survival deep in enemy territory.

You play as a Pilot whose attack aircraft has been shot down during a routine mission. Now, you have to evade enemies and survive the elements long enough to scrounge together a search and rescue beacon to summon help. Your time on the ground will not be easy. The odds are against you.

You may also be able to turn your misadventure into heroism if you can capture enemy intelligence, destroy some of their installations, or maybe find other MIA allies and return to safety with them.

Or maybe you'll get eaten by a bear while trying to hide from a storm in a cave.

IGD is a solitaire game driven by tables and cards. Inspired by games like Ambush! and Ranger, you will see the narrative of your Pilot's exploits unfold in front of you through a combination of cards drawn and tables rolled on. Careful planning and choices will be pitted against the vagaries of fate, and the wide range of available Event cards mean games can feel drastically different from one another. One game will be a ruthless hunt as you flee from dogged pursuers, another may be a battle against rains, wildfires and errant bombing runs, and the next may see the tables turned as you attack enemy installations with captured weapons.

—description from the designer

Name: Pigs R Poppin'
Description:
Pigs-R-Poppin' There's no stoppin.' Ready, aim, launch your Pig-o-nauts into the orbiting Sty-in-the-Sky.  All pigs in, you win!

Pigs-R-Poppin' consists of 16 soft rubber Pig-o-nauts, 4 brightly colored Booster-Launcher-Transporters (BLTs), and one Sty-in-the Sky space station. Players launch their Pig-o-nauts from the spring-loaded arms on their BLTs, aiming for docking bays in the Sty-in-the-Sky space station. To make their task more difficult, the Sty-in-the-Sky is constantly moving, turning on a single rubber tire at bottom of the space station.

The game ends when all the Pig-o-nauts are safely home in the Sty-in-the-Sky home ports. The winner is the one who has the most Pig-o-nauts in their home port. It doesn't matter who launches the Pig-o-naut, it's where the pig lands that counts!

Name: Valley of the Kings: Premium Edition
Description:
When you die, you can take it with you!

Take on the role of Egyptian nobles at the time of the pharaohs, preparing for death and burial in the Valley of the Kings. Players want to fill their tombs with food, canopic jars, statues, amulets and other treasures, and to do so they acquire cards that are laid out in the shape of a pyramid; purchase cards at the base of the pyramid, and it "crumbles" to bring cards higher in the pyramid to the base where they can be bought. The pyramid resets each round with new offerings.

You score only for cards that you remove from your deck and stash in your tomb, so if you keep using valuable cards for their effects and don't entomb them before the game ends, you could lose out on big points! Whoever collects the most valuable artifacts in their tomb wins.

Valley of the Kings: Premium Edition includes all the cards from the three previously released games (Valley of the Kings, Valley of the Kings: Afterlife, Valley of the Kings: Last Rites), plus the components needed to play with a fifth and sixth player. It also includes rules for solo play, dividers for all the cards, and new pharaoh cards that give their holder unique abilities. The components are upgraded to 300+ tarot-sized cards.

Name: EXFIL
Description:
EXFIL is a cooperative game for 4 players. You are members of Black Group, a special operations unit of military operators from around the globe. Black Group’s primary skills revolve around exfiltrating assets from difficult situations. It’s time to gear up!

EXFIL is a legacy campaign where your actions and decisions affect the course, landscape and difficulty of the game. You play as an Operator with a unique deck of cards that represent your skills. Over the course of each mission, you will need to make tough decisions involving managing your deck, managing Hostiles and fighting against the mission clock to complete objectives and reach the EXFIL point.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sketchagrams
Description:
Bring big laughs to game night with Sketchagrams, the hilarious hashtag drawing game from the makers of Pictionary. Create the perfect social media-inspired picture to accompany odd pairs of hilarious captions and hashtags!

Pull one caption card and two hashtag cards, then you have forty-five seconds to draw a picture inspired by the combination. When the time is up, each player votes on which illustration they find the most outrageously funny and grant the artist a LIKE token. You don't have to be a pro artist to steal the round -- in fact, the less practiced illustrators often end up with the funniest result! The player with the most LIKE tokens after four rounds is the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mini Skittle Alley
Description:
Tabletop miniature 10 pin bowling.

All the fun of 10 pin bowling only on a smaller scale! The objective is to knock down as many pins as possible. Each bowler has ten frames in which to knock down pins, with each frame being composed of up to two bowls.

Line up the aiming handle and push the marble down the alley. Skittles that are knocked over should be cleared off the alley before the second bowl. The crib can then be used to quickly and accurately set the skittles back for the next player.

—description from the publisher

Name: Finger Pool
Description:
A disc flicking version of classic billiards.

Use the triangle to rack the 15 billiard discs and flick the white cue disc to strike them. Basic pool rules apply, with the winner being the first to sink all seven of their billiard discs plus the number 8 disc. The felt covered gameboard rotates for easy tabletop playing and the woven string pockets ensure discs do not fall onto the floor.

—user summary

Name: Pocket Curling
Description:
Flick, block and ricochet your way to victory. Strategically shape the ice to your benefit, then thread your way through your opponent's stones to get to the house. Be the first team to reach 11 points by ending rounds with stones closer to the target than the other team.

—description from the publisher

A travel-sized, dexterity, curling game for two players/teams.

Name: Turkey Shoot
Description:
Bring the fun of a classic Turkey Shoot to your table.

Players load their shotgun card with bird shot or a slug and take aim at classic turkey shoot targets. Tilt the back of the shotgun up to dump your bird shot or slug onto the target and see if you can get the best shot and win a turkey. Each turkey claimed is worth points depending on its weight. After 10 events the turkeys are weighed and the player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Base Roll
Description:
A baseball/softball themed dice and card game.

There are three levels of gameplay: Rookie, Professional, and All-Star. The Rookie level is the basic level using only dice, while the other two levels add cards, which add levels of strategy.  As a bonus, this game will teach you the game of baseball as you play. If you don't know baseball, it's still easy to learn Base Roll.

Each team uses three dice to roll combinations that move their players around four bases to score points. Using your dice and cards, you can affect rolls and block potential base hits, bunts, and even home runs!

The game lasts 9 rounds (innings) and the player with the most runs wins the game.

-description from publisher

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Fortress of the Fallen Game Supplement
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Cherry blossoms hang in the air and the fires still burn as the dark shadow of the Fallen Shogun sweeps over another samurai castle. Though rich with the spoils of war, the fallen fortresses left in the wake of the Takobake Clan’s march of darkness lie in ruins, tainted by greed and despair. But there is hope as long as brave warriors hold true to their honor and stand against the Darkness.

This 15-card Forbidden Fortress Encounter Supplement is themed for exploring the inner chambers and courtyards of a samurai fortress that has fallen into darkness; filled with vengeful spirits, possessed objects, and secret passages.

CONTENTS

     Card #346 Secret Passage ×2
     Card #347 Cherry Blossoms ×2
     Card #348 Blood-Stained Blade
     Card #349 Ornate Chest
     Card #350 Path of Despair
     Card #351 Bushido Code
     Card #352 Ittan-Momen Attack
     Card #353 The Grim Tenome
     Card #354 Dark Ambition
     Card #355 Suzuri No Tamashii
     Card #356 Without Honor
     Card #357 Shadow of the Shogun
     Card #358 Thundering Steps

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Devoured by Darkness Game Supplement
Description:
Description from the publisher:

A deep roar shakes the spongy floor and ribbed walls of the living world, while fleshy bile pumps spurt acidic juices and chitonous Bone Mites scurry across the walls and ceiling. Within the Belly of the Beast, every aspect of the world around is trying to devour you as you pick your way through the pools of muck and fluttering flaps of the impossibly massive creature.

This 15-card OtherWorld Belly of the Beast Encounter Supplement is themed for the corrosive environment, deadly creatures, and terrifying living hazards that fill the pulsating tunnels inside the Belly of the Beast.

CONTENTS

     Card #359 Melted Skeleton ×2
     Card #360 Beast Quake ×2
     Card #361 Deep Roar
     Card #362 Necrotic Flesh
     Card #363 Bursting Pores
     Card #364 Dark Bonding
     Card #365 Sunken Bowels
     Card #366 Bile Pumps
     Card #367 Gonoyoku Clan Survivor
     Card #368 Mucus Grubs
     Card #369 Bone Mites
     Card #370 Fluttering Flaps
     Card #371 Stuck in Muck

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress – Artifacts #1 Game Supplement
Description:
Description from the publisher:

One of the most fun elements of Shadows of Brimstone is developing and customizing your Heroes. These new Gear cards focus on Item Upgrades, adding new Runes, Marks, and a host of characterful new trinkets that can be slotted onto your Heroes’ Items to add powerful bonuses and abilities.

This 15-card Supplement adds a set of all new Gear cards themed around Item Upgrades to add to your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

CONTENTS

     Card #372 Amulet of Sankarra ×2
     Card #373 Scroll of Thunder ×2
     Card #374 Siege Axe ×2
     Card #375 Nobuhara Shackles
     Card #376 Chochin Lantern
     Card #377 Takobake Rifle
     Card #378 Takobake Hat
     Card #379 Book of Seven Deaths
     Card #380 Blade of Vengeance
     Card #381 Tiger Pants
     Card #382 Yamabushi Leg Armor
     Card #383 Ring of Heaven

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Belly of the Beast Artifacts #1 Game Supplement
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Within the twisting tunnels and living chambers of the beast, there are countless terrors to behold, but priceless treasures also. Whether ancient artifacts consumed eons ago or living weapons torn from the muscular walls, the rewards for exploring deeper into the creature can be wondrous…if you can avoid being digested along the way. This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Belly of the Beast Artifacts for Forbidden Fortress, themed around the corroded items lost by previous explorers and terrifying organic weapons and items found within the dripping corridors and slimy chambers of this living world.

CONTENTS

     Card #384 Rupture Gland ×2
     Card #385 Sedimentary Stones ×2
     Card #386 Plasma Tick ×2
     Card #387 Squim Feeler
     Card #388 Burrowing Snarku
     Card #389 Mucus Whip
     Card #390 Gonyoku Sash
     Card #391 Gonyoku Katana
     Card #392 Gonyoku Clan Armor
     Card #393 Marrow Dagger
     Card #394 Marrow Plate
     Card #395 Burst Tube

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: The Sacred Mountains Game Supplement
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The misty valleys of the Sacred Mountains hold many secrets. It is a place of myth and legend, where fantastic creatures roam, and vast hoards of wealth and knowledge are held within the abandoned temples and mountain strongholds built into the rock. Now dragons circle the highest peaks, crumbling the stone towers and jagged spires with their sweeping tails. Many have ventured into the mountains in search of ancient treasures and mystic knowledge… most have never returned.

This 15-card Game Supplement for Forbidden Fortress introduces an all new Adventure Card – The Sacred Mountains, as well as a host of exciting new Gear, Artifacts, and Encounters themed for exploring this dangerous but rewarding region. With the new Adventure Card, any Mission can be played in the misty and magical Sacred Mountains, among the temples and strongholds built high into the peaks. This adds extra Danger as well as extra rewards to your Adventure!

CONTENTS

     Card #396 The Sacred Mountains (Adventure Card)
     Card #397 Traveler's Pack ×2 (Gear)
     Card #398 Walking Stick (Gear)
     Card #399 Water Flask (Gear)
     Card #400 Meteoric Shard ×2 (Forbidden Fortress Artifact)
     Card #401 Divine Tea Pot (Forbidden Fortress Artifact)
     Card #402 Amulet of Khan-to (Forbidden Fortress Artifact)
     Card #403 Rock Slide (Forbidden Fortress Encounter)
     Card #404 Breathtaking View (Forbidden Fortress Encounter)
     Card #405 Meteoric Fragment (Forbidden Fortress Encounter)
     Card #406 Ancestral Spirit (Forbidden Fortress Encounter)
     Card #407 Close to the Source (Forbidden Fortress Encounter)
     Card #408 Call of the Dragon (Forbidden Fortress Encounter)

Name: Starcadia Quest: Zenith Invasion
Description:
When a derelict cargo ship appeared on the radars, everyone thought that the day was saved - fresh new tacos were being delivered! But soon we all realized that the ship wasn’t responding to the hails, was careening towards Krier Station and wasn’t slowing down. It had to be hauled into a stop, and inside Starcadians found a surprising new threat: a race of swarming aliens quickly dubbed ‘Zeniths’ that moved efficiently and mercilessly. At least having an all-new threat should unify all Starcadians against it. Right? I mean the Crews would stop their quarreling over this, right? RIGHT?

The Kickstarter Exclusive Zenith Invasion Enemy Set brings a new group of hungry alien enemies that can be added to any Starcadia Quest Scenario, further increasing the range of available enemies!

—description from the publisher

Contains:
- 1 Hero Card
- 4 Monster Cards
- 14 Quest Cards
- 11 Highly-Detailed Plastic Miniatures

Name: Starcadia Quest: Thornetroopers
Description:
Not long ago in a quadrant far away, Supreme Commander Thorne put in motion a plan that has been kept in the utmost secrecy. Special orders were issued and the recruitment and training of a dedicated elite force started in earnest. This army of dedicated soldiers now stand ready at Thorne’s disposal, much to the dismay of Starcadians all across the galaxy!

The Kickstarter Exclusive Thornetroopers Enemy Set brings a slew of new enemies that can be added to any Starcadia Quest Scenario, expanding the possibilities of available enemies for backers, and bringing their *ahem* charming personality to your game sessions.

—description from the publisher

Contains:
- 2 Hero Cards
- 5 Monster Cards
- 11 Quest Cards
- 9 Highly-Detailed Plastic Miniatures

Name: Ragnarok: Heavy Metal Combat in the Viking Age
Description:
The end of the Aesir has come, but not as the prophecies foretold. The dread dragon Niddhoggr has devoured the roots of the World Ash, Yggdrasil, and the great tree has toppled onto its side, crashing the realms of mortal and supernatural together. With the gods dead and the fires of ruin consuming the world, your war clan of Viking warriors know what they must do to survive the destruction of the Nine Realms and restore order: they must become the new gods!

Ragnarok is a campaign-driven skirmish game in which players form a Viking war clan seeking to prove itself worthy of becoming the new pantheon. The use of a mechanic called Godspark means that battles are no longer determined by merely striking an opponent and dealing damage. Instead, warriors will be pushing, throwing, and crashing their opponents around the battlefield, making their very environment a weapon. As the war clans develop, they may gain glorious new powers that will bring them closer to godhood, or win the respect of the denizens of the realms, allowing them to bring dire wolves, dwarves, and even the dreaded giants into their war clans. With strategic gameplay and epic storytelling, players must write their own sagas and tell of how their war clans have, through blood and steel, clawed their way up from ruin to stand before the halls of Valhalla.

Name: Anticipation
Description:
Counters with numbered arrows indicate the direction along which each player will pick their following placement as players wrangle their counters across the hex plan board. Each player is attempting to connect 8 pieces or encircle any of the other players with 6 of their own to arrive at one of the four winning conditions first.

Cultivating more than a single attacking option and pre-positioning outliers along the same line form the basis of strategy.

Each player has 28 turns to make or foil those 8 connections without becoming unable to place in line with their preceding directional arrow or becoming themselves encircled.

This means that a game might come down to the longest continuous line of either players pieces as that which  distinguishes the winner.

—user summary

Name: Arena Colossei: Ludi Gladiatorii
Description:
Arena Colossei is a miniature game by Top Hat Games, set in ancient Rome. Choose your favourite combat technique and make your gladiator fight! The game can rely on three great features: amazing miniatures, an original and extremely competitive gameplay, historical accuracy at its highest level for what concerns this specific topic.

The game is divided into rounds. To begin with, each player must select which cards (minimum 1) they will play during the current round. Each card represents specific moves and maneuvers the gladiators can perform. The original FightHex System integrates all the information about orientation, armor and view directly on the miniatures' bases!

The round begins: the players must choose, alternatively, which move their gladiators will perform, trying their best to predict and counter the opponent's movements. At the end of each round all cards will be refreshed.

As soon as two miniatures are engaged, combat begins! Use Combat tiles to Defend or Attack a specific area of your opponent: block enemy attacks and penetrate their guard. In this phase, predicting where your opponent is going to hit and where they will block is essential! If your opponent's Defense tile does not match your Attack tile... your attack is a success, pull out a Damage token from the bag!

The Summa Rudis tracks Crowd Favor. Both if you penetrate the enemy's guard or block their attacks, move it towards your side. You win immediately if the Summa Rudis reaches the last space on your side of the track, or if at the end of the 15th round the Summa Rudis is on your side of the track!

The game can be played in two modes: Duel (1 Vs 1) and Melee (1 to 6 players). Moreover, each type of gladiator has four experience levels featuring special moves and techniques!

-description from publisher

Name: Hindsight
Description:
Hindsight: 2020 is a real-time cooperative dice-drafting puzzle game for 1 to 4 players. On your turn, you will select two dice of the same color from a grid of 36--the first, the ACTION DIE, determines your main action by its position and your bonus action by its value; the second die, the POWER DIE, determines the strength of first action. You will use the actions to manipulate the puzzle tiles, to alter the dice in the grid (for future turns), and to manage the timer. The adjustable difficulty level will keep you on your toes for play after play as your team gets better at solving the puzzle quickly. Thinky and frantic, saving the world has never been so fun.

Theme:
The apocalypse is upon us! If only we’d seen it coming. Luckily for the rest of humanity, you’ve just finished the prototype for your new time-intervention device. Alas, it’s a little unstable and unreliable--it is a prototype, after all. You’ve figured out what intervention is needed to stop the apocalypse, but it takes some tinkering to get the machine aligned so your operatives can make those changes. You have just a couple minutes to find the right configuration of your machine to send back our intervention agents and save the world. Can you finish before the apocalypse arrives? Time to find out.

Saving the world, as fast as you can. The game has two play areas, a 6 by 6 dice grid, and a tile tableau. The dice grid has twelve actions you may take, one for each row and one for each column. At the top of the tile area are six “keystone” tiles numbered 1-6, representing the code you need to match. In an array of 36 tiles below the keystone line are columns of similar tiles.

When you select your Action die, you place it at the end of either the row or the column, indicating which action you intend to take. Then you select your Power die, another die of the same color, and place it on the Power die space outside the grid. The action you selected is augmented by the Power die, and allows you to manipulate the tile tableau or the dice grid. After you take your main action, you get a secondary action determined by the value of the action die you took. These secondary actions allow you to flip the sand timer and add more dice to the grid, among other things.

To solve the puzzle, you need to manipulate the tiles so that the top of each column matches the keystone number above it. When the number matches, you can “lock” that combination in place, triggering the bonus (or penalty) card attached to that column. You win if you are able to lock all six columns before you run out of dice or timer flips. Of course, if you ever let the timer run out, you also lose.

This is how the world ends:
Accompanying Hindsight: 2020 is a thematic website that uses your six-digit keystone code to reveal what happened to cause the apocalypse, and how your team did or did not succeed in preventing the end of the world.

-description from designer

Name: The Raven
Description:
The Raven is a party game to be played while watching an episode of Game of Thrones. First players draft item, event, or situation cards, then they start an episode and play like travel bingo. First player to get rids of all their cards win.

-description from designer

Name: Memoir '44: New Flight Plan
Description:
Air supremacy was a constant challenge during World War II. In the Battle of France, the Luftwaffe's powerful Stukas were a key component to the German's blitzkrieg strategy that led them to victory. Over the English Channel, the heroism of RAF pilots saved their country from an invasion. In the skies of Kursk, Smolensk and Stalingrad, many Soviet pilots defended their land against German bombs. And when the Allied forces landed in Europe, it was under a constant aerial cover of fighters, fighter-bombers, and bombers. At that time, Allied air supremacy was at its pinnacle.

In the Memoir '44: New Flight Plan expansion, players can deploy air units such as fighters, fighter-bombers and even bombers to support their troops on the battlefield. This is not the first time airplanes will make an appearance in the Memoir '44 system, but with its all new set of streamlined rules, Memoir '44: New Flight Plan grants many new tactical options and is compatible with all existing scenarios in all theaters of operation. The expansion also comes with 21 new scenarios and 16 finely-crafted, legendary planes, in impressive sizes, such as the B-17 that measures 72mm by 101mm.

Name: Late Night Alias: Promo Card #1
Description:
New clue card for the game. The words are: 
1 Referee
2 Ear muffs
3 Heartbreaker
4 Chest
5 Afternoon delight
6 Cover

Card included in issue 27 of Tabletop Gaming

Name: Doujinshi of the Kings (王たちの同人誌)
Description:
çŽ‹ãŸã¡ã®åŒäººèªŒ (Doujinshi of the Kings) is a game about that most noble of quests, selling your own fan comics.

The game takes place in two phases. First everyone works on building their doujinshi, working to get one each of Title, Cover, Element, and Genre cards. If you have two of the same card, you can turn one to the dark side (usually worth negative points) and force it on to an opponent. After one person has one of each card on the Light Side you move on to the Event Phase.

In the Event Phase, it's finally the big day of the convention and everyone tries to sell their doujinshi. While base points are decided in the first phase, in the Event phase a variety of surprises can change everything around.

Name: Nemesis: Crawl Deck
Description:
Originally available as part of Promo Pack A from Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter Campaign.

Adds a new Basic Action called Crawl and a 10 card Crawl deck.
Crawl lets a character move between any two rooms connected by Technical Corridors for an Action cost of 1.
When a character crawls, they have to draw a card from the Crawl Deck and resolve it.

Name: Kiwi Scrabble
Description:
Kiwi Scrabble is just like the classic brain-teasing word game, but features a twist designed especially for the Kiwis. Using the slang one can only learn by being a proud New Zealander. Just like classic Scrabble, players earn points by forming interlocking words, cross-word fashion, using letter tiles with various score values. In a fun twist, the specially designed Kiwi Scrabble game board features "YEAH NAH" spaces -- if a player forms a word crossing one or more of these, they'll get to draw a "YEAH NAH" card that offers an advantage over their opponents. Also included is a Kiwi Word List, displaying heaps of Kiwi-specific slang and definitions to help you get creative with your word play. Play any word on this list to earn extra points that could help you win the game!

Includes game board, 100 letter tiles, 36 cards, 4 racks, cotton tile pouch (Which is Black only for the Kiwis), word list and rule book.

Name: Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar – Spider Springs
Description:
Fireball Island just got a whole lot bigger. There's just one problem: It's covered with spiders, and they have a nasty habit of "popping up" all over the place. Use the caves to get to the peninsula. Navigate the chasm to scoop up valuable spider eggs. Stop for a snapshot on the scenic bridge. But watch out! When Vul-Kar starts rumbling, the spiders start jumping!

This expansion adds a new location to explore, a new kind of treasure to collect and a new hazard: spiders! Spiders are worth negative points at the end of the game. In the center of the chasm is a spring-loaded "spider launcher". Marbles can trigger the launcher, sending spiders around the chasm or into a crevasse, where they can make their way onto the main island. You'll even send spiders through Vul-Kar with the new Arachnoclysm action card. It even offers a new way to get off the island via a secret submarine.

—description from the publisher

Name: Encyclopaedist
Description:
Encyclopaedist (ç™¾ç§‘å¯©è­°å®˜) is a three-player only game in which you're trying to give eight correct answers or place a correct answer in each of seven categories. What are those categories, and how is an answer correct? Read on...

To set up the game, lay out the yellow, green, and red loops so that they overlap like a Venn diagram and form seven specific regions: yellow-only, yellow-and-green, all three colors, etc. Each player represents one of these colors. Each player chooses a category in secret, with the category being something that can easily divide answers into "belongs" or "does not belong". Examples might be things with four legs, foods, games by Reiner Knizia, things you can cut, and school subjects. Each player writes something that belongs in their category, then the other two players move those answers to the proper region. (If you're yellow, for example, you must give an answer that belongs in the yellow category, but that answer might also belong in the red or green category as well.)

Following this set-up, on a turn one player places a token in one of the seven regions, e.g., inside the red and green categories but outside the yellow one. Each player now gives an answer that matches the status of their own category, then the other players say whether or not your answer is placed in their categories or not. If your answer fits within the proper region, then you score a point and leave the colored portion of your answer sheet visible; if it's not in the proper region, then you hide the colored portion (to show that you don't score), but leave the answer visible to give information to other players.

The first player to score 1 point in all seven regions or to score 8 points total wins.

Name: Pearls: Neue Halsketten
Description:
2 new cards for the game "Pearls" that are part of the annual Abacusspiele catalogue (printed on the backside).

They replace one or two of the pearl-cards from the game.

Card "10" can be taken if the player has 10 pearls of one color. The card counts 10 points and at the end of game, all cards left in hand have a value of 0 (they don't bring minus points).

Card "11" can be taken if within action B (put down hand cards) the player has 
a) only 1 card of each color and 
b) the sum of all cards has to be exactly 11.

The card counts 11 points.

Name: Fellowship of Fools: The (Friendship) Game
Description:
We are all Fools on our journeys through this world. It’s dangerous to go alone. Take this game with you.

Fellowship of Fools: The (Friendship) Game (or FoF) is based on the Tarot, in use since the 14th century for games and since the 17th century for divination. The art for Fellowship of Fools dates back to 1761 to its creation in France by Nicolas Conver de Marseilles and is called the Tarot de Marseilles. Today, Tarot cards are widely used  for game playing, creativity, divination and personal development. Our hope is that FoF can turn that inward reflection of the Tarot outward to help players develop friendships.

We’ve split the Tarot deck into its two parts—-the Major Arcana for Situations and the Minor Arcana for Topics. On each card are two different prompts—-corresponding to the upright and the reversed meaning of the card. Numbers next to the prompts indicate their difficulty, possible points that can be gained or lost for playing that prompt, as well as the number of Topic Prompts that can be played for that Situation Prompt.

There are multiple ways to play Fellowship of Fools: The (Friendship) Game: solo, with two players, or with multiple players. We encourage players to experiment with the cards and find their own ways to play. Visit to our Gamplay page to see the many ways to play, then experiment with the game and submit your own ways to play!

—description from the designer

Name: Animals Poop Race
Description:
In this game you play as a "pooplord" of a preselected kingdom. Your goal is to grow up your animals from "Puppy" stage to "Wise" stage. How? You have 3 types of cards: Animals, Kingdoms and Extras. Animals are your creatures, your babies, you take care of them. Each animal belongs to a kingdom. There are 6 Kingdom cards: Alpacas, Flamingos, Pandas, Unicorns, Sloths and Dinosaurs. Your goal is to own 3 animals of your kingdom on your field, complete of their "poop markers" aka being Wise. Extra cards can help you doing that! EXTRAS are 2 different types: TRICKS (can be used unlimitedly and in any moment) and TREATS (can be played max 2 per turn unless specified otherwise). Each turn has different phases. The first thing you want to do is to position "poop markers" on your animals card (does not apply in the first player's first turn). You get 1 poop marker per animal. Then you draw 2 cards, choosing between the 2 decks (animals deck, extras deck), the combination is up to you (1/1, 2/0, 0/2). You can play a maximum of 2 cards per turn, if there aren't cards in your field allowing you to play more. Playing cards, the player should try to prevent opponents to stack poop markers on animals while trying to fully stack his own animals. The winner is the first player owning 3 wise animals on his field. During the "stacking poop" phase, poop markers can't be prevented, so be sure to clean up the poop you want to delete before the next player's turn's begin (before your ending phase, to be clear). All this stuff fits into funny artworks and weird characters!

—description from the designer

Name: Panzertroops: Infantry Assault
Description: 15mm Paint'n'Play box set.  INFANTRY ASSAULT contains a squad each of Germans and Americans plus rules, paints and a painting guide. This is one of two games in the Paint'n'Play Panzertroops series. The companion game, TANK ATTACK, used the same rules, but contained tanks as well as infantry.

Name: Singin' in the Game!: On augmente le volume
Description:
In this first expansion of Singin' in the Game!, you will find more than 260 new french speaking artists, some new variations and 18 jokers (such as "Don't play this card" , "Find another song", "choose your category"...) to add even more interactions to the game.

On augmente le volume est la première extension pour Singin' in the Game!

Celle-ci contient:


     Plus de 260 nouveaux artistes.
     18 jokers pour encore plus de coups-bas et d'intéractions.
     Plusieurs variantes dont un mode solo "compétitif".

Name: Singin' in the Game!: Le volume est à fond !
Description:
In this second expansion of "Singin' in the Game!", you will find more than 260 new french speaking artists, some new variations and 20 jokers (such as "Steal a joker to another team" , " The right to find lyrics in spite of singing", " Don't make any mistake"...) to add even more interactions to the game.

Singin' in the Game! (vol3): Le volume est à fond! est la seconde extension du jeu Singin' in the Game!

Celle-ci contient:


     Plus de 260 nouveaux artistes.
     Plusieurs variantes.
     20 nouveaux jokers.

Name: Jungle Chase
Description:
A terrible drought has struck a bountiful jungle and all the animals are left with no food to eat. Jungle wardens' airplanes are parachuting food packages to the animals, but each animal prefers its own kind of food! To complicate the matters further, all packages look the same and animals first need to open them to see what's inside. All the animals rush wildly for the clearings where food packages appear...

The object of Jungle Chase is to collect as many food packages as possible before they run out. Players do so by controlling six animals each of varying strength on a hexagonal board representing a jungle with clearings and landing spots for food packages. On their turn, players roll two six-sided dice to determine which animals may move one space each, with doubles enabling special moves. When animals of opposing players meet the stronger animal chases its opponent off the board.

Contents of food packages are hidden from players and a player whose animal enters the package space may look at it without revealing the contents to other players. If the food is appropriate for the animal, the player may now collect it. When all packages, whose number is determined at the beginning of the game, have been collected the player with the most food is the winner.

Jungle Chase is a "classical" board game with game pieces, dice and a board with a very deliberate old-school feel and yet quite modern in it's final execution in terms of tempo, duration etc. Basic mechanics and inherent logic are quite simple and yet the game strives to offer enough depth for an adult to enjoy the game as well.

—description from the designer

Name: Haulin'
Description:
Every day, semi trucks haul loads across the country on short and long hauls. How these loads get to their destinations takes planning and a knowledge of the highways of our country.

Choose a handle, take the driver’s seat of a semi truck, and test your skills against other truckers as you cross the country in an effort to rise to the top of the trucking industry. Haulin’ is an immersive game that will put you in the drivers seat of your very own semi truck. Traveling through an often changing world of natural disasters and dreaded road construction, as a semi driver, your job is to choose which loads you want to pick up and deliver to cities in need. Choose to deliver dedicated loads which only you have been hired to haul or race against fellow truckers to be the first to deliver nationwide dispatch loads. Be warned, trucking is a competitive business. As you race to haul more loads than anyone else, keep an eye on the other truckers.

The trucker who delivers all of their dedicated loads first, ends the game. However, the trucker who delivers the most loads to cities in need will win the game, so plan well and get Haulin’!

Name: 4XS
Description:
The Universe has long been too sparse for the human race. We must now enter the Multiverse. A breakthrough in dimensional travel has opened up Pathways to parallel universes. Our mission is the first of its kind. Many more will follow.

You command a space fleet headed by a state of the art Carrier. Your mission is to eXplore these new regions, eXpand your capabilities, eXploit Systems, and eXterminate those who try to stop you.

Your whole life as a replicant, from creation to this very moment, was planned. From this moment forward, we must embrace uncertainty. Captain, your return may not be guaranteed, but the discoveries you make could be as infinite as the Multiverse itself.

4XS is a print and play 9 card 4X space game for 1 to 2 players with an optional legacy mode.

The game packs 64 thematic missions, innovative market mechanic, a light 4X game with a sand box feel, and a 3 episode legacy campaign into 9 cards and a few components.

—description from the designer

Name: Cutthroat Captains
Description:
You’re vying to become the “Most Dreaded” Captain of the seas.  Dread points are earned by spending booty at ports and by returning alive. For each Dread point earned, gain 1 jewel.

Each Captain commands five pirates.  When pirates meet up in the seas, they form a crew (place your pirate on top).  Any time a pirate sets sail, he takes his crew with him (any piece above in the stack).    Sailing into a Whirlpools flips the stack. Gather cards to control the winds and the seas. 
Scoring:

1. Earn Dread Points by spending treasure at port on supplies, rum, and entertainment.

2. When crossing the scoring line, the pirate’s stack that is crossing receives 1 Dread Point per piece in his or her stack.  Other pirates along for the ride receive 1 point per piece of their own.

The first pirate to earn 10 Dread Points wins, and is the most dreaded Cutthroat Captain.

—description from the designer

Name: Cryptkins: The Card Game
Description: Cryptkins: The Card Game uses Cryptozoic's "Gryphon" card game engine to deliver a simultaneous, easy-to-learn tabletop experience. Each player has a ten-card deck that allows them to call forth allies or use super powers.

Name: Benjamin Blümchen: Café Blümchen
Description:
Dice Game with six different Variants. You try to get most pieces of a cake, or get rid of cherries you can place on a cake.

Incl. 12 pieces of cake, 12 chips, 2 meeples, 1 dice and the rulebook.

"To the icing on the cake, ready, go! Sure, when Benjamin opens a small café, everyone is there. And everyone wants a piece of the Neustadt cherry cake. It's a good thing that there are six delicious dishes here. So everyone is guaranteed to find something that tastes good when dicing."

Name: Founding Fathers: Civil War & the Gilded Age
Description:
Major expansion for Founding Fathers (2007) by Rick Heli that enables play through the Civil War, Gilded Age and the First World War.

New Features:
- Variable Outcome cards that provide random results when fighting major wars, including the wars of the base game.
- A new player action that enables gaining and taking from others votes in Congress.
- The Election Table that provides a new mechanism for resolving elections based mostly on the way the previous President conducted affairs.
- The possibility of sudden death victory via Regime change.
- New Offices such as the Admiral.
- Initiative cards that offer Presidents more options.

Offers two new scenarios, one for the Civil War, one for the Gilded Age. Rules also permit continuing the base game so as to play from the administration of Washington to that of Wilson.

Adds 198 cards, including 75 Issues and 65 Statesmen.

Requires the base game cubes and some of its cards to play.

Compatible with the Offices & Statesmen and Ladies & Orators expansions.

Name: Empires of the Void II: Hogran Promo Cards
Description:
This is a set of four promo cards that were provided to backers of the 2018 Secret Cabal Kickstarter campaign.

These promos feature four new Action cards to be used with Empires of the Void II and feature a race called the Hogran.  These Action cards are unique in that, when played, have an ongoing effect that is applied to the rest of the game for your benefit.

Name: Feudum: Rudders & Ramparts – Kickstarter Edition
Description:
The Kickstarter edition is a compilation containing Feudum: Rudders & Ramparts and Feudum: Rudders & Ramparts â€“ Lone Isle Promotional Card

By Jove! A splendid array of vessels have arrived at port. Will you use your wealth to procure a craft—or save your shillings to reinforce your ramparts?

The Rudders & Ramparts expansion features artisan-edition vessels and castles that may be used purely for decoration—or to play a military variant of the game Feudum!

Upon acquiring a regular vessel or feudum, players may pay an additional shilling to upgrade to a deluxe vessel or castle feudum. Players earn +1 attack for a deluxe vessel and +1 defense for a castle feudum. At the dawn of each epoch, players must pay 1 shilling to maintain each castle or deluxe vessel in their possession—or lose their advantage!

These minor rule additions add a boatload of interesting choices! Players with castles forego the need to reinforce their feudums with subjects because a gold-clad "royal guard" accompanies each castle! Conversely, deluxe vessels make targets of any opponent in a nearby port. But beware! The expensive upkeep may slowly impoverish a player.

-description from designer

Name: Folklore: The Affliction – Fall of the Spire
Description:
The Fall of the Spire expansion contains six more stories, featuring new mechanisms for combat and town events. Play as one of four new archetypes, or continue your campaign with your existing characters from the Folklore: The Affliction core game and Dark Tales expansion. In this new expansion the design team at Twin Fire takes us down to the dark streets and up to the rooftops in the towns of Kremel. Then, travel further into the world with new stories, characters, monsters and afflictions. Explore new combat mechanisms that can be used in this new box expansion as well as be added to the core game and Dark Tales expansion.

You have traveled the dangerous byways of Kremel, and finally walk past the gates of the town at twilight. Once eager to see so many people bustling in the streets, you have grown jaded and keep an eye out for pickpockets. Beneath the buildings, stone and wood edifices, you notice the layers of dust and grime, and a deepening of the shadows. A shopkeeper waves in recognition, and looks to you in hopes of news from the outside world. But you have a darker destination in mind, and no time to spare. You nod back, and take to the rooftops, and later descend to the sewers, where you hope to find the missing piece that will take you to the one place that will doom or save this land...the Dark Spire.

Features:

     Extend your campaign with six new full-length stories and many hours of replayable content
     Expand your urban crawl by adding new Town Event cards
     New mechanisms include initiative, rooftop combat, and hazards 
     Four new characters to choose from: the Warlord, Huntress, Gentleman, and Viper Maiden
     New abilities, rumors, artifacts, afflictions, creatures, companions, maps, monsters, and items

Name: Your Mother Is A Whore
Description:
The logical gamification of the age old insult that’s been traded in bars, man-caves and on Shakespearean stages for centuries, Your Mother Is A Whore is a fast paced, interactive and hilarious game where you get to defend your Mother’s honor by handing out Whore Points™ while dodging them yourself.

Build out a hand in Blonde, Brunette, Redhead or Raven to tell all your friends: Your Mother is a Filthy Whore! Maybe dive into someone else’s hand with a Threesome, or if someone is trying to dish out Whore Points to you, Cockblock them. Still, sometimes there’s just nothing left to do but resort to Because Fuck You, That’s Why! This game has a deck just for that too.

If you love the hilarious inappropriateness of Cards Against Humanity, but also like a more structured, social game as well, Your Mother Is A Whore will deliver tons of laughs along with its fun, highly interactive 'take that' gameplay.

—description from the publisher

Name: Vs. System 2PCG: Crossover Vol. 1
Description:
Crossover is a complimentary companion set to previous issues, and this year’s Crossover features all new playable cards for the following teams: A-Force, Femme Fatales, Champions, Inhumans, Monsters Unleashed, Leviathons, S.H.I.E.L.D., Hydra, the Brotherhood of Mutants, Spider-Friends, and the Sinister Syndicate.

This 55 card Issue includes 6 new Main Characters and 10 new Supporting Characters to add to your decks!

This is not a stand-alone game.

Name: Desolate: Insurgence
Description:
Desolate: Insurgence is an expansion for Desolate, which adds the ability to play the game with up to four players. In addition to the ability to play with multiple players, Insurgence also adds the Scrap Pile micro expansion. You will need both the core game and both Dark Matters Boosters to use Insurgence.

What Comes in the Box?

1 Stout Box - This extra sturdy box is twice the size of the core game box and will house both the core game and all expansions.

4 Player Cards - These jumbo cards allow each player to track their own character's resources.

1 Position Tracker - This jumbo card keeps track of which tactical position each player is in.

6 16mm Black Dice - Now each player can track their own conflicts.

9 8mm Cubes - These are for each player to track their resources.

4 Jumbo Meeples - These translucent meeples are used to track the player's position.

10 10mm Silver Cubes - Track your scrap with these tokens.

1 Exploration Card - The Workshop allows you to spend scrap to build a power cell.

1 Character Card - Play as a robot with all new mechanics.

6 Items - More items to find, including two all new ones.
